alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 19 at 12:17PM MST until November 20 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...North winds 30 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Central and western Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties. * WHEN...From Monday morning through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. Travel on east/west roads could be difficult, including Interstate 70, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... The most intense winds are expected west of a line from Stratton to Firstview in the headlined counties.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
